name: Aloo Gobi
steps: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric, coriander powder, and salt.
Add potatoes and cauliflower, mix well.
Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes until tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander.
description: A classic North Indian dry curry made with potatoes and cauliflower.

name: Dal Tadka
steps: Pressure cook dal with turmeric and salt until soft.
Heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and dried red chilies.
Add onions, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies and sauté.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Pour this tadka (tempering) over the cooked dal.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot with rice.
description: Creamy lentils tempered with aromatic spices.

name: Chicken Curry
steps: Marinate chicken with turmeric and salt for 15 mins.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 mins.
Add tomato puree and spices (cumin, coriander, chili). Cook until oil separates.
Add chicken and sear on high heat.
Add water, cover, and simmer for 20 mins until chicken is cooked.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish.
description: A comforting home-style chicken curry.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
steps: Heat butter in a pan, sauté onion paste until brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook well.
Add turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Add water and simmer to form a thick gravy.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Stir in cream and crushed kasuri methi (fenugreek leaves).
description: Rich and creamy paneer cubes in a buttery tomato gravy.

name: Vegetable Pulao
steps: Wash and soak rice for 20 mins.
Heat ghee in a pot, add whole spices (cumin, cinnamon, cloves, bay leaf).
Add onions and sauté.
Add vegetables and rice, stir gently.
Add 2 cups water and salt. Bring to boil.
Cover and cook on low heat until water is absorbed and rice is fluffy.
description: A fragrant one-pot rice dish with vegetables.

name: Masala Dosa
steps: Heat oil, pop mustard seeds, add curry leaves and chilies.
Add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add turmeric and mashed potatoes. Mix well to make the masala filling.
Heat a tawa (griddle), spread a ladle of batter thin.
Drizzle oil/ghee around edges.
When crispy, place a spoonful of potato masala inside and fold.
description: Crispy fermented crepe filled with spiced potato masala.

name: Idli Sambar
steps: Steam idli batter in molds for 10-12 mins.
Cook dal with veggies until soft.
Add tamarind extract, sambar powder, and salt. Boil.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Serve hot idlis with sambar.
description: Steamed rice cakes served with lentil and vegetable stew.

name: Chole Bhature
steps: Pressure cook chickpeas with tea bags until soft.
Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes.
Add chole masala and cooked chickpeas. Simmer.
For bhature: knead flour with yogurt and salt. Rest for 2 hrs.
Roll into circles and deep fry until puffed.
Serve chole with hot bhature.
description: Spicy chickpeas served with fluffy deep-fried bread.

name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices. Grill or pan-fry.
Heat butter, add tomato puree, cook until reduced.
Add cashew paste, spices, and cream. Simmer.
Add cooked chicken pieces.
Simmer for 10 mins. Garnish with cream and kasuri methi.
description: Global favorite, sweet and spicy creamy chicken.

name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 mins, then ice bath. Puree it.
Heat oil, add cumin, onions, ginger-garlic. Sauté.
Add tomatoes and cook.
Add spinach puree and spices. Simmer for 5 mins.
Add paneer cubes and cream. Cook for 2 mins.
description: Cottage cheese in a nutritious spinach gravy.

name: Rajma Masala
ingredients: 1 tsp rajma masala or garam masala
steps: Pressure cook rajma until very soft.
Sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked rajma and some water. Mash a few beans to thicken gravy.
Simmer for 15 mins. Serve with rice.
description: Comfort food featuring red kidney beans in thick gravy.

name: Kerala Fish Curry
steps: Soak kokum in water.
Make a paste of chili powder and turmeric.
Heat coconut oil in earthen pot (chatti), add mustard, curry leaves, shallots.
Add spice paste and cook (don't burn).
Add water and kokum. Bring to boil.
Add fish pieces. Swirl the pot (don't stir with spoon).
Cook covered until fish is done. Drizzle fresh coconut oil.
description: Tangy and spicy fish curry made with kokum.

name: Poha
steps: Rinse poha in colander, drain immediately.
Heat oil, fry peanuts until crunchy. Set aside.
In same oil, add mustard seeds, chilies, onions, potatoes.
Add turmeric and salt.
Add rinsed poha and mix gently.
Cover and steam for 2 mins.
Garnish with lemon juice, coriander, and peanuts.
description: Light, fluffy flattened rice breakfast dish.

name: Upma
steps: Dry roast rava until fragrant. Set aside.
Heat oil, add mustards, dals, curry leaves, ginger, chilies.
Add onions and veggies if using. Sauté.
Add 3 cups water and salt. Boil.
Slowly add rava while stirring efficiently to avoid lumps.
Cover and cook on low for 3 mins.
description: Savoury porridge made from dry roasted semolina.

name: Vada Pav
steps: Temper mashed potatoes with mustard, curry leaves, turmeric, crushed garlic-chili.
Make small balls of potato mix.
Dip in thick salted besan batter.
Deep fry until golden.
Slit pav, spread chutneys, place vada inside.
description: India's version of a burger - potato fritter in a bun.

name: Chicken Biryani
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, herbs, fried onions for 1 hr.
Par-boil rice with whole spices until 70% cooked.
Layer marinated chicken at bottom of pot.
Layer rice on top.
Drizzle saffron milk and ghee.
Seal pot with dough or foil. Cook on low heat (dum) for 30-40 mins.
description: Layers of fragrant saffron rice and spiced chicken.

name: Egg Curry
steps: Peel boiled eggs and prick with fork. Shallow fry them lightly with turmeric.
In same pan, sauté onions and ginger-garlic.
Add tomato puree and spices.
Cook until gravy thickens.
Add eggs and simmer for 5 mins.
description: Boiled eggs in a spicy tomato-onion gravy.

name: Baingan Bharta
steps: Roast eggplant on open flame until skin is charred and flesh is soft.
Peel skin and mash the flesh.
Heat oil, sauté garlic, onions, and chilies.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add mashed eggplant, salt, and spices. Cook for 5 mins to blend flavors.
description: Smoky mashed eggplant stir-fry.

name: Gajar Ka Halwa
steps: Heat ghee, roast nuts and set aside.
Add grated carrots and sauté for 5 mins.
Add milk and cook on medium heat until milk evaporates (approx 20 mins).
Add sugar and cook until mixture thickens.
Add cardamom and roasted nuts.
description: Sweet carrot pudding made with milk and ghee.

name: Rasam
steps: Extract tamarind juice.
Boil tamarind water with tomatoes, rasam powder, garlic, and salt.
Once raw smell goes, add more water to desired consistency.
Bring to frothy boil (don't overboil). Add crushed pepper-cumin.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves. Garnish with coriander.
description: Tangy and spicy tamarind soup, good for digestion.
